intro: Burmeistera virescens, commonly known as the green burmeistera, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It is part of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, featuring broad, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Burmeistera virescens is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
